reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: Personal identifiers such as a real name, birth date, e-mail address, and unique personal identifier; information related to individuals like name, physical characteristics, health or medical information, insurance policy number, and employment.

content: Personal identifiers: real name, birth date, e-mail address, unique personal identifier
Information related to individuals: name, physical characteristics, health or medical information, insurance policy number, employment

reply.analysis: Based on the Personal Data section of the privacy policy document, it is clear that the app collects personal data that includes personal identifiers and information related to individuals.
reply.reference: Categories of Personal Data. URL: https://firefly.health/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The app clearly states that they only collect and use Personal Health Information (PHI) for providing services on their platform. They mention that PHI will not be used for any purposes other than providing services without user consent.
reply.reference: We will only collect and use PHI for the purposes of providing the Services on our Platform and we only collect the minimum amount necessary to fully perform and provide the Services on our Platform. PHI will not be used for any other purpose, including marketing, without your consent. URL: https://firefly.health/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt-out of data collection by clicking the unsubscribe link at the bottom of any e-mail or other marketing communications received from Firefly Health. However, the opt-out does not apply to information provided as a result of product purchase or use of the platform and services.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy outlines the user's ability to opt-out of data collection specifically for marketing purposes but notes some exceptions related to product purchase or platform use.
reply.reference: If you do not wish to have your e-mail address used by Firefly Health to promote our own Products and Services, you can opt-out at any time by clicking the unsubscribe link at the bottom of any e-mail or other marketing communications you receive from us or logging onto your Account Preferences page. This opt out does not apply to information provided to Firefly Health as a result of a product purchase, or your use of our Platform and/or the Services. You may have other options with respect to marketing and communication preferences through our Platform. URL: https://firefly.health/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties for various purposes such as marketing, research, and product development.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with third parties for multiple reasons, including marketing, research, and product development.
reply.reference: The app may share data with third parties for various purposes such as marketing, research, or product development. For example, the app may share information like gender, height, weight, medication details, and data from connected devices with third parties. URL: https://firefly.health/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with affiliates, vendors, service providers, business partners, healthcare providers, family members, other health-focused mobile apps, third-party analytics tools like Google Analytics and Mixpanel, and with third parties for marketing purposes.

content: third-party analytics tools (Google Analytics and Mixpanel)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy outlines the various third parties with whom data may be shared, including affiliates, vendors, healthcare providers, and third-party analytics tools.
